moves.1. e4: Hi everyone, I am taking a trip down memory lane, in fact 12 years ago.  This is my second local Bury League Match.  This is Cambridge City Chess Club playing against the ICI Sheepdogs in a place called Stowmarket somewhere in Suffolk, United Kingdom.  I was on board 4 of 4 in that match.  I had to do the driving, so it was very nice to drive home after what happened in this match.
moves.2. d4 d5 3. Nd2: 3. Nd2 - the Tarrasch Variation of the French Defense, backing up the e pawn and if the pawns are exchanged the knight will have a fine outpost on e4.
moves.3... dxe4 4. Nxe4 Nf6 5. Nxf6+ Qxf6 6. N: 6. Nf3 - I decided to take on e4 - not sure that was wise though.  A knight exchange on f6 follows shortly after that.
moves.6... h6 7. Bc4 c5 8. O-O Nc6 9. c3 Bd6 1: 15. gxf3 - after blundering a pawn on my 10th move, I try and negate white's advantage by shattering her kingside pawn structure.
19. ......... bc6 - putting pressure on the white f3 pawn.
moves.20. Kg2 Re7 21. b4 Rbe8 22. c4 a6 23. a4: 27. .......... g6 - pawn pushes and exchanges over the last few moves have resulted in both players having pawn islands.  White has islands on both sides and black has an island on the queenside.  Black is still a pawn minus but I am hoping for a drawn ending with opposite bishops once the rooks have been swapped off.
31. ........... Kxe7 - now the rooks have been swapped off and it seems to be heading for a draw, but there are a few surprises yet.
moves.32. Kf3 Ba5 33. Ke3 Ke6: 33. ......... Ke6 - both kings centralise themselves for the endgame.
moves.34. Bf3 Kd7: 34. ......... Kd7 - to protect the pawn on c6.
moves.35. Kd4 Be1 36. Ke5: 36. Ke5?? - white is thinking about gobbling up my kingside pawns but my bishop has other ideas.
moves.36... Bc3#:
36............. such as Bc3# - Old Matey Strikes out of the blue!  Incredibly the white king has no squares to go to, the check cannot be blocked, the bishop cannot be captured so all this equals ........... CHECKMATE!!

What a finale to a seemingly boring endgame!
